caption:
This photograph captures a landscape dominated by industrial activity, juxtaposed with natural and man-made features. In the foreground, there's a grass-covered embankment leading down to a brownish water body, possibly a polluted river or stream. The water's surface reflects hints of the surroundings and the sky.

To the right, a highway curves alongside this embankment, featuring an old car that adds a temporal marker to the scene, suggesting the era might be around the mid-20th century, considering the model of the car and the style of the image. Next to the road, a towering rust-colored truss bridge carries a series of railway tracks over the highway and extends towards the industrial complex in the background.

The background is densely packed with industrial structures, including large buildings, multiple smokestacks, and industrial machinery, all under a hazy sky suggesting air pollution. Several of the smokestacks are actively emitting plumes of smoke, contributing to the industrial atmosphere of the scene.

Overall, the composition of the photograph presents a study of contrasts—nature and industry, movement and stillness, pastoral greens and industrial grays—with each element framed to lead the observer’s eye through various aspects of environmental impact.
title: Entrance to the kaiser aluminum plant.  Because of the corrosive fumes from this and other plants in the area, the bridge (which spans the Mississippi river) must be constantly sandblasted and repainted
